xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Class AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.functions.Function
      xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels.AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND
extends Function

This class provides a native implementation of a n-dimensional kernel based density estimator based upon a sample of data given by objects of type double []. This class implements a native kernel density estimator, meaning no boundary treatment is used nor any other optimizations. To every given n-dimensional sample value a bandwidth is needed. This bandwidth is used for every dimension the kernel estimator will be evaluated at. Per default the adaBand rule is used for computing the bandwidths, if they are not given otherwise. But one is able to give otherwise computed bandwidths to this class. For further details about the adaBand rule see
[DG01]: Domeniconi, Carlotta. Gunopulos, Dimitios. An Efficent Approach for Approximation Multi-dimensional Range Queries and Nearest Neighbor Classification in Large Datasets. 2001.
The estimator is updatable, so one can use it as an aggregate function combined with a special aggregation iterator. But it is recommended not to do so because recomputing the bandwidths could be quiet expensive, especially if adaBand is used for computation.
The estimator is implemented as a function expecting objects of type double [].
A sample of any kind of data given by an iterator could be easily obtained through the reservoir sampler cursor.

See Also:
Aggregator, Iterator, Function, AbstractKernelDensityEstimator, AbstractKernelCDF, KernelFunction, KernelFunctionND, KernelBandwidths, KernelBandwidths.adaBand(Object[] sample, Iterator data, Distance distance, int quantil), Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND

public AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND(KernelFunctionND kf,
                                       Object[] sample,
                                       double[] h)
                                throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs an estimator for a n-dimensional density function using the given n-dimensional kernel function. This class implements a native kernel density estimator, meaning no boundary treatment is used nor any other optimizations. Per default the adaBand rule is used for computing the bandwidths, if they are not given otherwise. But one is able to give otherwise computed bandwidths to this class.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function.
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type double [].
h - used bandwidths according to the used sample
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bandwidths doesn't match the number of sample values

AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND

public AdaBandKernelDensityEstimatorND(KernelFunctionND kf,
                                       Object[] sample,
                                       Iterator data,
                                       Distance distance,
                                       int quantil)
Constructs an estimator for a n-dimensional density function using the given n-dimensional kernel function. This class implements a native kernel density estimator, meaning no boundary treatment is used nor any other optimizations. Per default the adaBand rule is used for computing the bandwidths, if they are not given otherwise.

Parameters:
kf - used Kernel function.
sample - sample of a data set given as Object[] containing objects of type double [].
data - data used for computing the bandwidths based upon adaBand
distance - distance used for computing the bandwidths based upon adaBand (see adaBand for further details)
quantil - parameter for computing the bandwidths based upon adaBand (see adaBand for further details)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the number of bandwidths doesn't match the number of sample values
Method Detail

invoke

public Object invoke(Object x)
              throws IllegalStateException
Evaluates the n-dimensional kernel based density estimator at a given point x represented by an object of type double [].

Overrides:
invoke in class Function
Parameters:
x - argument where to evaluate the density estimation
Returns:
value of the estimated density at x
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if after calling setSample(Object[]) or calling setBandwidth(double[]) the number of bandwidth values doesn't match the number of sample values

setSample

public void setSample(Object[] newSample)
Sets a new sample. If the sample has changed, i.e. old_sample.equals (new_sample) returns false, changed will be set true.

Parameters:
newSample - new sample to use

setBandwidth

public void setBandwidth(double[] h)
Sets the new bandwidths. If the bandwidths have changed, changed will be set true.

Parameters:
h - new bandwidths to use

hasChanged

public boolean hasChanged()
Indicates whether something has changed. If so, a recomputation may become necessary.

Returns:
true, if anything has changed.
